clinical_study.brief_title: Surveillance of Non-invasive Streptococcus Pneumoniae Infections in Belgium
clinical_study.official_title: A 20-months Surveillance of Non-invasive Streptococcus Pneumoniae Infections in Belgium to Evaluate National Vaccination Strategy

brief_summary.textblock: We will conduct a prospective observational study of non-invasive S. pneumoniae infections in Belgium and characterize serotype distributions to evaluate national vaccination programs.

detailed_description.textblock: We will conduct a 20-months (September 2020-May 2020) surveillance of non-invasive S. pneumoniae infections in Belgium. Monthly, 12 peripheral hospitals will send the first 15 unduplicated clinical S. pneumoniae samples (coming from patients diagnosed with pneumonia, otitits media or sinusitis) to Sciensano. Sciensano will determine the serotype and the antibiotic resistance profile of these clinical isolates. Whole genome seuqencing will be performed on a subset of these isolates.

primary_outcome.measure: Establish insight in serotype dynamics for non-invasive pneumococcal diseases in Belgium prospectively, in association with changing vaccination programs (campaigns).
primary_outcome.description: There is a wealth of information available on the serotype distribution of S. pneumoniae causing inavsive pneumococcal disease (IPD). However, much less is known about the serotype distribution of S. pneumoniae causing non-invasive pneumococcal disease (NIPD). The goal of this study is to characterize the serotype distribution of of S. pneumoniae causing NIPD in Belgium, compare is with IPD data and link it with the changing national vaccinations programs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Surveillance of emerging serotypes, clones and drug resistances. Study of the genetic divergences between invasive and non-invasive pneumococcal diseases isolates.
secondary_outcome.description: To date, little is known about serotype distribution in NIPD and how this relate with the more widely studied serotype distribution in IPD. This study aims to shed light onto this topic.

biospec_descr.textblock:
Streptococcus pneumoniae samples will be collected and stored during the time frame of this study.
DNA extraction and whole-genome sequencing will be performed for a subset of these strains.

study_pop.textblock: Patients suffering from non-invasive pneumococcal disease (diagnosed as CAP, sinusitis and otitits media) and living in Belgium at the time of the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients living in Belgium at the time of the study,
- from whom unduplicated S. pneumoniae isolates were collected in routine practices,
- from non-invasive upper (e.g.: pus/fluid from nasal sinus or from otitis media fluid) or lower respiratory tract (e.g. sputum bronchial or endotracheal aspirate, bronchoalveolar fluid (BAL),…) clinical samples,
- from patients diagnosed with pneumonia, sinusitis and otitis.
Exclusion Criteria:
• Patients for whom S. pneumoniae was simultaneously isolated from blood or another usually sterile specimen
